=== Introduction ===

This page gives the Bug Triager of Mozilla packages a quick overview about bug states used
and formal requirements attached to the individual states in form of a checklist

=== States ===

==== NEW ====

* '''Status''': NEW
* '''Aliases''': Initial Contact, Screening, Categorization
* '''Requirements''': None
* '''How to Triage''':
## check if bug is filed against right package
## set to "Incomplete"
## process bug as if it was "Incomplete" (read below)

==== INCOMPLETE ====

* '''Status''': INCOMPLETE
* '''Aliases''': Gathering Information, Crash Traces, Testcase and Reproduce and find Tester 
* '''Requirements''':
  1. NEW processing
* '''How to Triage''':
## Ask for missing information
## Crashes: strace, backtrace, if possible way to reproduce (if not, ask for steps the user took to cause the crash)
## Feature Bugs: Steps to reproduce (starting with fresh profile)
## '''normalize description and summary''' (see <nowiki>[[MozillaTeam/NormalizedBugFormat]]</nowiki>)
## set to "CONFIRMED", once Requirements of CONFIRMED state are fulfilled (see below)

==== CONFIRMED ====

* '''Status''': CONFIRMED
* '''Aliases''': Upstream Triage, Evaluation
* '''Requirements''':
## <nowiki>[[MozillaTeam/NormalizedBugFormat]]</nowiki>
## Crashes: strace + backtrace
## Rendering Bugs: Screenshots
* '''How to Triage''':
  1. Identify if its an upstream bug or ubuntu specific; if in doubt test with upstream build.
* '''How to Triage''' (Upstream Bug):
## Search for upstream bugs in bugzilla.mozilla.org
## file a new upstream bug and CC the ubuntu@bugs.distro user on the mozilla bug. (see <nowiki>[[MozillaTeam/HowToFileMozillaBugsUpstream]]</nowiki>)
## Connect existing upstream bug with launchpad bug
* '''How to Triage''' (Ubuntu Bug):
  1. if reproducible or a reasonable evaluation of the bug exists set to TRIAGED.
